meanings.definition: Present information in a way that is intended to provoke public interest or excitement.
meanings.sent1: The news channel tends to sensationalize stories to grab viewers' attention.
meanings.sent2: Some newspapers sensationalize headlines to sell more copies.
meanings.sent3: The tabloid sensationalized the story about the cat who could dance.
meanings.sent4: Her speech sensationalized the importance of recycling in our community.
meanings.sent5: The movie sensationalized the hero's journey to make it more thrilling.

meanings.definition: Make something seem more exciting or shocking than it really is.
meanings.sent1: The advertisement tried to sensationalize the benefits of the new product.
meanings.sent2: Some reality TV shows sensationalize the drama for higher ratings.
meanings.sent3: The children sensationalized the size of the fish they caught at the lake.
meanings.sent4: Her painting sensationalized the beauty of the sunset on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The author sensationalized the love story to captivate readers.
